nodes.body: @dignissimus You might also be interested in #13233

### PR summary [2917c133b2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13442/commits/2917c133b20522ba3c00fb342ebe6c65c24a0935)

#### Import changes for modified files

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Additive_identity`
`+ id'`
`+ ofMul_identity`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thank you for this PR! It would be desirable to have `mabel` and implementing it via a `to_additive` tactic seems reasonable to me!

(As mentioned in PR #13233, we currently thought your approach was preferable as it's simpler to maintain; given that there aren't massive short-comings that haven't been identified yet)

However, `to_additive` itself will need improvement, as mentioned below, delaborating the expressions back into terms is probably the wrong approach! Maybe you could ask for help in the ["metaprogramming/tactics" stream on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics) if you want to.

Thank you for this PR! It would be desirable to have `mabel` and implementing it via a `to_additive` tactic seems reasonable to me!

(As mentioned in PR #13233, we currently thought your approach was preferable as it's simpler to maintain; given that there aren't massive short-comings that haven't been identified yet)

However, `to_additive` itself will need improvement, as mentioned below, delaborating the expressions back into terms is probably the wrong approach! Maybe you could ask for help in the ["metaprogramming/tactics" stream on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics) if you want to.
As far as I understand, your `to_additive` always requires an equality, doesn't it?
I would like to see some `to_additive` specific tests, too.

I think this needs improvement. For one thing, going via `delab` seems wrong to me!

Regarding `to_additive at h`, I think the skeleton would look like this:

```lean
syntax (name := to_additive) "to_additive" (location)? : tactic

elab_rules : tactic | `(tactic| to_additive $[$loc]?) => withMainContext do
  let loc := (loc.map expandLocation).getD (.targets #[] true)
  withLocation loc
    (atLocal := fun h ↦ do
      pure ()
    )
    (atTarget := do
      pure ()
    )
    (failed := fun _ ↦ throwError "to_additive made no progress")

```
